title: WCAS PHIL 109-6-22 First-Year Seminar in Philosophy

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Isaiah Berlin once declared that romanticism brought about "the greatest single shift in the consciousness of the West that has occurred." In this course, we will focus on romantic conceptions of poetry and language: particularly on the quintessentially romantic claim that art is capable of revealing truths that are inaccessible to us in any other manner. We will start with some precursors of the romantic movement in Germany (like Herder and Schiller), before proceeding to several representatives of the romantic movement in Germany and England (including the Schleiermacher, the Schlegels, and Shelley).

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: This course is designed to help you -familiarize yourself with one of the most important movements in modern European thought -understand how philosophic themes can be developed in various literary forms -improve your writing.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be a number of writing assignments.
